obsolete_code/

mgt.pro

includes main-level program

NAME: MERRYGOTRACE

PURPOSE: Finds the center of 3 suns in a single image. Currently limited to a .bmp test image. Instead of scanning rows to crop, scans in a circle.

Author information

Author

JEREN SUZUKI:

Space Sciences Laboratory 7 Gauss Way Berkeley, CA 94720 USA E-mail: jsuzuki@ssl.berkeley.edu

Routines

makelimbstrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, file, ministrip_length, scan_width, sundiam [, nstrips=byte], region=integer [, time=time]

Makes limb strips from full-length strips

result = quickmask(image, thresh)
result = whichcropmethod(file, region, scan_width, sundiam, thresh)
makestrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, file, scan_width, sundiam [, nstrips=byte], region=integer [, time=time]

Only saves 5 strips centered around the solar diameter to reduce the amount of limb- darkened pixels and to make the polynomial-fitted limbs more-or-less look similar.

circscancrop, mainxpos, mainypos, file, image, xpos, ypos, xoffset, yoffset, scan_width, sundiam, thresh, region=integer [, time=time]

Quickly finds the center of the main sun, scans in a circle, and locates the two secondary suns' centers.

result = mainsuncrop(file, scan_width, sundiam, time=time)
merrygotrimask, image, file, xpos, ypos, xoffset, yoffset, scan_width, sundiam, thresh [, time=time]

Had to make a new version of comp3 because the old one called scanbox() by default

limbfit, thresh, xpos, ypos, file, ministrip_length, order, scan_width, sundiam [, nstrips=byte] [, plot=plot], region=integer [, time=time]

Uses the data from makelimbstrips and fits an n-th order polynomial to the limb to find where it crosses the threshold.

getstruct, file, struct, scan_width, sundiam [, time=time]

Finds the centers of a triple-sun image and loads all relevant information including offsets and angles into a new structure.

Routine details

top source makelimbstrips

makelimbstrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, file, ministrip_length, scan_width, sundiam [, nstrips=byte], region=integer [, time=time]

Makes limb strips from full-length strips

Parameters

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used to select pixels

xstrips
ystrips
file in required type=string default=triplesun.bmp

File to be read in

ministrip_length in required type=byte default=13

How long the total array of the cut-down strip will be

scan_width in required type=integer default=5

Indicates how far apart to scan

sundiam in required type=byte default=70

Approximate diameter of sun in pixels. (Based on bmp image)

Keywords

nstrips in optional type=byte default=5

How many strips to select, centered around the row/col diameter

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Prints the elapsed time

Other attributes

Todo:

Exactly how much data should be stored in a structure? Since we're interested in saving space, doesn't make sense to repeat any data in the structures.

top source makestrips

makestrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, file, scan_width, sundiam [, nstrips=byte], region=integer [, time=time]

Only saves 5 strips centered around the solar diameter to reduce the amount of limb- darkened pixels and to make the polynomial-fitted limbs more-or-less look similar.

Parameters

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used to select pixels

xstrips out required type=structure

Structure containing row strips

ystrips out required type=structure

Structure containing column strips

file in required type=string default=triplesun.bmp

File to be read in

scan_width in required type=integer default=5

Indicates how far apart to scan

sundiam in required type=byte default=70

Approximate diameter of sun in pixels. (Based on bmp image)

Keywords

nstrips in optional type=byte default=5

How many strips to select, centered around the row/col diameter

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Prints elapsed time

top source circscancrop

circscancrop, mainxpos, mainypos, file, image, xpos, ypos, xoffset, yoffset, scan_width, sundiam, thresh, region=integer [, time=time]

Quickly finds the center of the main sun, scans in a circle, and locates the two secondary suns' centers. Crops either of the secondary suns based on what region specified.

Parameters

mainxpos
mainypos
file in required type=string

What file to load in

image
xpos out required type=float

Computed X position of center

ypos out required type=float

Computed Y position of center

xoffset
yoffset
scan_width in required type=integer default=5

How apart the scans are for minicrop().

sundiam in required default=70

Approximate diameter of sun in pixels. (Based on bmp image)

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used in finding center

Keywords

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Print the elapsed time

top source limbfit

limbfit, thresh, xpos, ypos, file, ministrip_length, order, scan_width, sundiam [, nstrips=byte] [, plot=plot], region=integer [, time=time]

Uses the data from makelimbstrips and fits an n-th order polynomial to the limb to find where it crosses the threshold.

Parameters

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used to select pixels

xpos out required type=float

X center

ypos out required type=float

Y center

file in required type=string default=triplesun.bmp

File to be read in

ministrip_length in required default=9

How long the trimmed down strip will be

order in required type=integer default=3

What order polynomial to use for POLY_FIT()

scan_width in required type=integer default=5

Indicates how far apart to scan

sundiam in required type=byte default=70

Approximate diameter of sun in pixels. (Based on bmp image)

Keywords

nstrips in optional type=byte default=5

How many strips to select, centered around the row/col diameter

plot in optional

Makes some nice plots

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Prints the elapsed time

top source getstruct

getstruct, file, struct, scan_width, sundiam [, time=time]

Finds the centers of a triple-sun image and loads all relevant information including offsets and angles into a new structure.

Parameters

file in required type= string default= 'triplesun.bmp'

What file to find 3 centers for

struct out required type=structure

Structure containing the centers and cropped images of all 3 suns

scan_width in required type=integer default=5

How apart the scans are for minicrop().

sundiam in required type=byte default=70

Approximate diameter of sun in pixels. (Based on bmp image)

Keywords

time in optional

Outputs how much time the program takes
